1.text: But Baldad the Suhite responded by saying:

2.text: How long will you throw around words? Understand first, and then let us speak.

3.text: Why have we been treated like mules, as if we were unworthy before you?

4.text: You, who ruins your own soul in your fury, will the earth be forsaken because of you, and will the cliffs be moved from their place?

5.text: Will not the light of the impious be put out, and the flame of his fire refuse to shine?

6.text: Light will become darkness in his tabernacle, and the lamp that is over him will be extinguished.

7.text: His strong steps will be constrained, and his own counsel will cast him down uncontrollably.

8.text: For he has caused his own feet to go into a net, and he has walked into its web.

9.text: His heel will be held in a snare, and thirst will rage against him.

10.text: A trap has been hidden for him in the earth, and a decoy, along his path.

11.text: Horrifying things will terrify him everywhere and will entangle his feet.

12.text: Let his strength be diminished by famine, and let starvation invade his ribs.

13.text: Let it devour the beauty of his skin; let the ancient death consume his arms.

14.text: Let his confidence be torn away from his tabernacle, and let ruin trample over him like a king.

15.text: Let the companions of he who is not, dwell in his tabernacle; let brimstone rain down upon his tabernacle.

16.text: Let his roots be dried up from beneath him, and his harvest be crushed from above.

17.text: Let the memory of him perish from the earth, and let not his name be celebrated in the streets.

18.text: He will expel him from light into darkness, and he will remove him from the world.

19.text: Neither his offspring, nor his descendents, will exist among his people, nor will there be any remnants in his country.

20.text: The last will be astonished at his day, and the first will be overcome with horror.

21.text: And so, these are the tabernacles of the sinful, and this the place of he who does not know God.
